intro: Cyclosorus chamaeotaria, commonly known as the small green stonewort, is a species of freshwater algae belonging to the order Coleochaetales. It is characterized by its compact, branching structure and the presence of chlorophyll-containing cells that contribute to its photosynthetic activity. This plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its morphology includes a basal holdfast and a thallus composed of short, segmented branches. Cyclosorus chamaeotaria plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and contributing to nutrient cycling.
